body:
Problem: Buffer events (specifically on_bytes callbacks) weren't triggered when the 
quickfix list was modified, preventing buffer change notifications.

Solution: Add code to send both bytes and lines change notifications after 
quickfix buffer updates to properly trigger all attached callbacks.


Fix #31085

Splicing should still happen without buffer updates.


Looking at `qf_fill_buffer()`, it seems multiple lines can be replaced when `old_last == NULL`, so this should be reflected in `old_row` here. Probably:
```suggestion
      extmark_splice(buf, 0, 0, old_line_count - 1, 0, old_byte_count, new_line_count - 1,
```
? Would be good to add a test that replaces multiple lines.

Instead of all the new code (below), could we maybe change `qf_fill_buffer` to use `nvim_buf_set_lines` or `nvim_buf_set_text`, which already call `extmark_splice` + `changed_lines` in the expected way?

I guess not, because it looks like `qf_fill_buffer` is doing extra behavior per-line...

this test file is for the lua interface to bufupdates, whereas the fix is a low-level change, so probably fits better in `api/buffer_updates_spec`. perhaps after the diff-mode test here: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/76d213efbee8e6857b3aa397827fa8756a327430/test/functional/api/buffer_updates_spec.lua#L584

#31085 mentions `on_bytes`, but the fix in this PR is simply to enable buffer-updates, so there is no need to test all the "lua callback" functionality. Instead we just need to verify that buffer updates are working in quickfix bufs (using `expectn('nvim_buf_lines_event',` or whatever common practice is in `api/buffer_updates_spec`).

I have a issue with https://github.com/OXY2DEV/tree-sitter-qf, which seems fixed by this PR.

Repro:
```sh
cd /tmp; git clone https://github.com/OXY2DEV/tree-sitter-qf; cd tree-sitter-qf
tree-sitter g; tree-sitter b; mkdir parser -p; mv qf.so parser/; mkdir queries/qf/ -p
echo '"|" @punctuation.delimiter' > queries/qf/highlights.scm
nvim --headless --clean --cmd "set rtp+=." +"call setqflist([], ' ', {'lines' : repeat(['.editorconfig:1: '],10) })" +copen +"lua vim.defer_fn(function() vim.fn.setqflist({}, ' ', {lines={'.editorconfig:1: '}}) end, 10)" --cmd 'au FileType qf lua vim.treesitter.start()'
```
